info.description:
# ðŸ“˜ Postman Collection Documentation For 90 North enfund.io Assignment ## ðŸ“Œ Overview This Postman collection allows you to test all API endpoints of the backend system, including: - **Google OAuth 2.0 Authentication** - **Google Drive API (Upload, Fetch, Download)** - **WebSocket Real-time Chat** The collection is structured to simplify authentication and testing, ensuring smooth API interaction. --- ## ðŸš€ How to Import Postman Collection 1. **Download the Postman Collection JSON** - The collection file is named `postman_collection.json`. 2. **Open Postman** - Navigate to `File > Import` or click `Import` in the Postman UI. 3. **Select the** **`postman_collection.json`** **file** - Click `Open` and import the collection. 4. **Set Up Environment Variables** - Go to `Environments` in Postman and create a new environment. - base_url = [http://127.0.0.1:8000](http://127.0.0.1:8000) --- ## ðŸ“Œ API Requests in Postman Collection ### **1ï¸âƒ£ Google OAuth 2.0 Authentication** | Method | Endpoint | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `GET` | `{{base_url}}/api/v1/auth/google/` | Get Google OAuth login URL | | `GET` | `{{base_url}}/api/v1/auth/google/callback/` | Handle Google OAuth callback & return user info | - **Step 1:** Open `Get Google OAuth URL` and send a request. - **Step 2:** Copy the authentication URL and log in. - **Step 3:** Exchange the authorization code for tokens using the `Google Callback` request. - **Step 4:** Copy the returned `access_token` and use it for feature request. --- ### **2ï¸âƒ£ Google Drive API** | Method | Endpoint | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `POST` | `{{base_url}}/api/v1/google/drive/upload/` | Upload a file to Google Drive | | `GET` | `{{base_url}}/api/v1/google/drive/list/` | Fetch list of userâ€™s Google Drive files | | `GET` | `{{base_url}}/api/v1/google/drive/list/{{file_id}}/` | View and Download a single file from Google Drive | #### **Uploading a File to Google Drive** - Open `Upload File to Drive` request. - Select a file in `form-data` under the `file` key. - Click `Send` to upload. - Copy the `file_id` from the response and store it in Postman for future requests. #### **Fetching Files from Google Drive** - Open `Fetch Google Drive Files` request. - Send the request to retrieve a list of available files. #### **Downloading a File from Google Drive** - Open `Download File from Drive` request. - Replace `{{file_id}}` with an actual file ID retrieved from the list. - Click `Send` to get download file link. --- ### **3ï¸âƒ£ WebSocket Chat (Real-time Messaging)** | WebSocket | Endpoint | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `WS` | `ws://127.0.0.1:8000/ws/v1/chat/?token={{access_token}}` | Real-time chat connection | #### **Connecting to WebSocket Chat in Postman** 1. **Open Postman and click** **`New`** **\>** **`WebSocket Request`****.** 2. ws://127.0.0.1:8000/ws/v1/chat/?token={{access_token}} 3. **Click** **`Connect`****.** 4. { "message": "Hello from Postman!" } 5. **Receive messages from other users in real-time.** --- ## ðŸ§ª Common Errors & Troubleshooting | Error | Cause | Solution | | --- | --- | --- | | `401 Unauthorized` | Invalid or expired OAuth token | Refresh the token and update it in Postman variables | | `403 Forbidden` | Missing Google API permissions | Ensure Drive API is enabled in Google Cloud Console | | `Connection Refused` | WebSocket server is not running | Restart Django server using
python3 manage.py runserver | --- ## ðŸŽ¯ Summary - **Google OAuth 2.0** enables secure authentication. - **Google Drive API** allows users to manage their files. - **WebSockets** provide real-time chat functionality. - **Postman Collection** makes API testing simple and efficient. ### âœ… **Now youâ€™re ready to test all features!** ðŸš€

request.description:
This is a GET request and it is used to "get" data from an endpoint. There is no request body for a GET request, but you can use query parameters to help specify the resource you want data on (e.g., in this request, we have `id=1`).

A successful GET response will have a `200 OK` status, and should include some kind of response body - for example, HTML web content or JSON data.

This is a POST request, submitting data to an API via the request body. This request submits JSON data, and the data is reflected in the response.

A successful POST request typically returns a `200 OK` or `201 Created` response code.
